thread.title: Arsenal watching Celtic defender Kieran Tierney on a regular basis
thread.title_full: Arsenal watching Celtic defender Kieran Tierney on a regular basis

author: Simon Rice
title: Arsenal watching Celtic defender Kieran Tierney on a regular basis
text:
Kieran Tierney in action for Celtic (Getty) Arsenal have been watching Celtic left-back Kieran Tierney on a regular basis this season, according to reports.
Arsene Wenger sees the left side of his defence as ripe for improvement, casting doubts over the futures of current options Nacho Monreal and Kieran Gibbs.
Confirmed: Man Utd ace seals transfer away - could leave Old Trafford next week Wenger’s thoughts on the position were signalled in January when he signed non-league player Cohen Bramall for the position.
Tierney has been arguably the best left-back in the Scottish Premiership this season, proving himself a key member of Brendan Rodgers’ side. And according to the Telegraph , Arsenal have been paying close attention by monitoring him throughout the campaign.
The 19-year-old made his debut for Celtic back in 2014.
Nacho Monreal is the current favoured choice, starting 24 Premier League games. Gibbs has started three (Getty) More: Football Mourinho reveals the one reason he can't turn Man Utd into a force like Chelsea 
CL giants offer Wenger two-year contract ahead of Arsenal talks 
Alexis Sanchez hints at bad news for Arsenal on Instagram 
Reports in the past have suggested Arsenal starlet Chris Willock could be used as a makeweight in any deal should the Gunners follow up their interest with an offer.
MORE: Arsenal’s Arsene Wenger offered two-year Paris Saint-Germain deal 
MORE: Alexandre Lacazette and Kylian Mbappe lined up to replace Mesut Ozil and Alexis Sanchez at Arsenal
